channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd December
item.description:
Two lots of fly tipping, one in the alley, and one in the carpark that backs on to Lesnes Abbey Wood
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manorside Close, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manual sweeping required please to clear up loose chippings from road defect, 2nd December
item.description:
Chippings from ongoing road defect in need of clearing up please. Danger to pedestrians and motorists alike. Pavement and road to be cleaned up please. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 120-122, High Street, Goddington, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting still not mended, 2nd December
item.description:
Street lamp lighting in Playfield Crescent was reported not working in mid-September. It still hasn’t been repaired. reference is SFSL2467040.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Playfield Crescent, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped household waste, 2nd December
item.description:
Sofa, black bags, car seat and other household waste has been dumped on the pavement, next to the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steedman Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Albany St near to Chester Gate NW1, 2nd December
item.description:
The pavement is raised outside building near to corner with Chester Gate NW1. Trip hazard esp. in the dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Idling., 2nd December
item.description:
Driver idled his engine for at least 45 mins. Still refused to turn it off. There were two of these "tea buses" alongside the Shell Garage. One was fine, engine OFF, but the other parked bus was pumping out fumes for at least 45 mins Why are there no council inspectors at this time? Gone home?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Ranelagh Grove, Belgravia, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Willesden Lane and Kingsley Road, 2nd December
item.description:
Flytipped drinks chiller cabinet o/s Vijay’s Indian restaurant, 49 Willesden Lane, on public footway

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner Albany St and Chester Gate NW1, 2nd December
item.description:
At this corner the pavement is raised and is a large trip hazard for passers by.

item.title: Fly tipped sofa and timber/waste, 2nd December
item.description:
This waste has been on the pavement for at least a week, so clearly has been fly tipped. Brown leather sofa and some timber and black bags about 20 metres down the road, at the bus stop across the road from Watson General Telegraph pub.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, Greater London

item.title: None of the lamp posts on foot bridge are not working., 2nd December
item.description:

item.title: Broken pavement causing raised slabs, 2nd December
item.description:
The damaged pavement outside 191 Carlisle Lane, SE1 7LH has been here for more than 10 months which is the time that we have been using the archway building. We have had many accidents due to it. Stacks of containers fall because the trollies get stuck in the broken pavement. It needs to be resurfaced. I have reported this already and been told that it is not Lambeth.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Virgil Street, Lambeth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Willesden Lane and Streatley Road, 2nd December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London

item.title: Sunken manhole covers and drainage gullies, 2nd December
item.description:
There are a few sunken drain covers and gullies as you come onto Homerton Road. There is also a drain covers that has become dangerously sunken as you come off the traffic light from Eastway to turn right onto Homerton Road. This is not TFLs responsibility
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road has not be swept, 2nd December
item.description:
It is now 5 weeks since the whole of Colberg Place has been swept. Half of the road was swept last Monday. The leaves are now compacted on the pavement making it slippery

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colberg Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This area rarely gets cleaned, 2nd December
item.description:
This is the outside of a primary school. It doesn't seem to be looked after by Lewisham and is constantly dirty and littered.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham Way, New Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no 19. a pothole and sinking. It is not visible in the dark. my bicycle front wheel and I was tipped off my bike. I was hurt. I have two independent witness. if this is not reaired within three days, I'm afraid I will have recourse to legal action in pursuit of personal damages, 2nd December
item.description:
This pothole has appeared recently outside No 19 Wadham Gardens. The road has sunk revealing gravel infilling and a deep cavity. It is invisible in the dark. KLast night my bicycle wheel went into the pothole and I was thrown off it. I was shaken. Two independent witnesses have given me their details. I trust that this will be rectified within a few days. If not, with regret, I would consider taking legal action for damages
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Wadham Gardens, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is no longer a public bin, 2nd December
item.description:
There is not longer a waste bin at this bus stop. The planter next to the bus stop is constantly full of the waste that would go in the bin if it existed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham Way, New Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
